column4: I just updated to Ubuntu 7.04 from Ubuntu 6.06 and now X.org won't start. I have an ati radeon xpress 200m which uses fglrx, but even if I change fglrx to vesa in xorg.conf, it won't load anyway, and even after dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg it still doesn't work, what can I do?
boot the livecd and look at the xorg.conf it uses, and use that as a guide to fixing yours
though the livecd does not use fglrx afaik
ok, as long as it doesn't use "ati"
the radeon xpress 200m won't work with ati, anyway in previous versions of Ubuntu it never did
mine is a mobility card, for a laptop
neither did my x850... does in feisty
at least as far as the acceleration goes... I could get it to work before if I shut all that off, but it was dog slow
seeing as how it works properly with my video card?  yes...
what about the new proprietary driver thingy? does that work well?
no idea... I won't use proprietary software if I can help it
I have an athlon 64 cpu but I installed the i386 cause in the past I always ran into a problem with the amd64 variant
I like to run into problems... only way they will ever get fixed...
well, true, I'm just not much of a developer, wish I could help though
testing and filing detailed bug reports helps too
